title: Lori Loughlin faces additional charge in college admissions scandal
text:
Lori Loughlin and husband Mossimo Giannulli facing new charge in college admissions scandal (Picture: Getty)

Lori Loughlin is facing a fresh charge in the college admissions scandal, which has left her ‘on the verge of breaking point’.

According to a notice from the US Department of Justice, the 90210 actress, and husband Mossimo Giannulli, are facing an additional charge each of conspiracy to commit federal programs bribery – the theft or bribery of an organisation that receives more than $10,000 (£7,777) in federal funds.

The charge carries a penalty of up to 10 years in federal prison.

As well as this, the couple – parents to Olivia Jade and Bella – had already been facing charges of money laundering conspiracy, conspiracy to commit mail and wire fraud, and honest services mail and wire fraud.

If found guilty on all counts, they could be behind bars for around 50 years.

Loughlin and Giannulli have been charged among several others, after allegedly paying $500,000 (£409,000) to falsely designate Olivia Jade and Bella as recruits to the University Of Southern California crew team, even though neither of them had ever participated in the sport.

They both pleaded not guilty to all charges, and are awaiting trial after turning down a plea deal that involved jail time.

Lori is accused of paying $500,000 to falsely designate daughters Olivia Jade (photographed) and Bella a place on the crew team at USC (Picture: FilmMagic)

And an insider claimed the actress, 55, feels she has been made a ‘scapegoat’ of the situation.

The source revealed: ‘They feel like this is David versus Goliath. How do you go up against the federal government, when the government has decided to make an example out of you? How can you possibly move forward from this?

‘This stress is about to break them.

‘It just gets worse and worse for her. And you have to remember: nothing new has happened. They could have charged her with all of this last spring. But they waited.

‘She feels like she is a scapegoat,’ they added to People.

Felicity Huffman is currently serving a 14-day jail sentence (Picture: AFP)

Felicity Huffman is currently serving a 14-day jail sentence for her part in the admissions scandal.

The Desperate Housewives actress pleaded guilty to paying $15,000 (£12,100) to doctor daughter Sophia’s university entrance exams.

As well as her prison term, Huffman was also handed a $30,000 (£23,300) fine, one-year of supervised release and 250 hours of community service.

A statement issued to People by Huffman’s rep said: ‘Ms. Huffman is prepared to serve the term of imprisonment Judge Talwani ordered as one part of the punishment she imposed for Ms. Huffman’s actions.

‘She will begin serving the remainder of the sentence Judge Talwani imposed — one year of supervised release, with conditions including 250 hours of community service — when she is released.’

Speaking at her sentencing hearing, the TV star – best known for playing Lynette Scavo – said: ‘I am deeply sorry to the students, parents, colleges and universities who have been impacted by my actions.

‘I am sorry to my daughter, Sophia, my daughter, Georgia, and my husband, Bill. I have betrayed them all.’

Metro.co.uk has contacted Lori’s reps for a comment.
